post.title: Hololive’s UMISEA Sub-Unit Releases New Single
post.content:
UMISEA, one of the VTuber sub-units under Hololive, has released a new single titled “It Comes Ryuuu And It Goes Kyuuu”. The track–almost two minutes long–is also accompanied with a music video.

UMISEA is now composed of Hololive Japan talents Houshou Marine, Minato Aqua and Sakamata Chloe; as well as Hololive English talents Gawr Gura and Ninomae Ina'nis. The track was teased during a short anime video titled Going Missing, featuring all of the aforementioned talents being at sea.

The sub-unit was first formed on September 14, 2021, along with the single release “Domination! All the World Is an Ocean”. The unit was formed due to the ocean-like similarities between the lore of each talent.

Banner Photo via Hololive on YouTube · © 2016 COVER Corp.

node.description: A few weeks ago, we reported that AniManGaki 2022, one of the biggest annual anime/cosplay/gaming events in Malaysia, will showcase 80 VTubers.
